questions.question_text: When creating a date filter in Tableau, to what does Anchor relative to refer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Anchor relative to" refers to the date in a relative-date filter to which you anchor a unit of time.

Selected Answer: D
Default is D
The anchor date represents the start date of your first repetitive planning period

choices.B: The mid-point in the range of displayed dates.
choices.A: The latest date in the data source that can be found.
choices.D: The date in a range-of-dates filter to which you anchor units of time.
choices.C: The date in a relative-date filter to which you anchor a unit of time.

questions.question_text: What is the default behavior of Tableau when you add a measure to the view?

choices.B: You are prompted to add an aggregation.
choices.A: An aggregation is applied that varies depending on the context of the view.
choices.D: An aggregation is applied that is independent of the context of the view.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. An aggregation is applied that varies depending on the context of the view.

A is the right answer. When you drag a measure to the view, it is aggregated by default. The type of aggregation will vary depending on the type of view. You should always check the aggregation and change it if necessary. For details, see “Change the default aggregation” in Edit Default Settings for Fields. For more details about aggregation, see Data Aggregation in Tableau.

Selected Answer: BCD
B. A full refresh is usually very slow. An incremental refresh can take less time.
C. A full refresh replaces all the extracted data with the data in the underlying data source.
D. An incremental refresh only adds rows that are new

choices.A: An incremental refresh can only be run from Tableau Server.
choices.E: A full refresh must be configured. An incremental refresh is the default extract in Tableau.
choices.B: A full refresh is usually very slow. An incremental refresh can take less time.
choices.C: A full refresh replaces all the extracted data with the data in the underlying data source.
choices.D: An incremental refresh only adds rows that are new

questions.question_text: In an extract, what are three differences between a full refresh versus an incremental refresh? (Choose three.)
Which of the following is a discrete date part?
Which two types of data are represented as measures in Tableau Desktop? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Quantities such as student enrollment and products sold
choices.A: Numerical totals such as test scores, sales and profit totals
choices.C: Names of people such as students and customers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. Numerical totals such as test scores, sales and profit totals
B. Quantities such as student enrollment and products sold

Selected Answer: AB
A. Numerical totals such as test scores, sales and profit totals
B. Quantities such as student enrollment and products sold

AB
A. Numerical totals such as test scores, sales and profit totals
B. Quantities such as student enrollment and products sold
